body.name: KEDSUM Heated Shower Mirror Fogless for Shaving, 3 Color Dimmable Shower Mirror with Light, No-Tools Wall Mounted, 360° Swivel, Waterproof, Rechargeable Real Glass Shaving Mirror for Men/Women
body.stockDetail: This item cannot be shipped to your selected delivery location. Please choose a different delivery location.
features: 【Heated Anti-Fog Tech】Upgrade electronic heated shower mirror with only 1-2mins preheat, and keep its surface warm to prevent fog. No need to use anti-fog spray/squeegee/anti-fog coating! Our shaving mirror is a real GLASS mirror, not distorted plastic.

【5000mAh 3-Color Dimmable】Shower mirror is a 3-color dimmable light, you can easily adjust the brightness by long pressing, and it has a memory function: it can remember the brightness of each mode individually. High-Performance Lithium Battery-5000mAh, only needs to be charged once a week.

【Protection Mechanism】Fogless mirror will automatically turn off after 15 minutes of inactivity. It will automatically power off when the temperature is higher than 149℉(65℃) and resume working when it is lower than 122℉(50℃). Therefore, it is recommended not to use the heating function continuously for more than 30 minutes.

【Multi-Function】The detachable shower mirror fogless for shaving can be easily removed from the hook on the wall, you can rotate the mirror to choose the way you like to observe the shaving process. IPX4 waterproof function makes the mirror the best choice for your shower and shave.

【Easy Installation】The shaving mirror comes with two 3M traceless back stickers, which can be installed on bathroom walls, tiles, doors, and any clean and smooth surface without any residue without tools. NOTE: Our ball heads can be rotated and removed! Extremely convenient!
【More options】 If you need a higher definition view of the facial to handle the details of your face, choose the 3X attribute helping you to shave cleaner.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what i was looking for
reviews.reviewText: I had been looking for a working fogless mirror for some time. I purchased several others; most claim to be fogless but are not. Others are fogless for the first few uses, then they're not. However, this fogless mirror carries promise why because it does not use an "ant-fog coating." Instead it uses simple science and heats the mirror. I couldn't for the life of me understand why other mirrors did not do the same, especially when they're battery-powered anyway. I have only had the mirror for a day and used it once, but it has so far impressed me. The defogging feature works like a charm as long as you remember that it's a long two-second press to activate it rather than a simple tap. The light is very bright and allows for a clear unobstructed view. Despite the great experience so far, I have two critiques of this item. 1. it uses an adhesive to stick to the bathroom wall. It's 2024, and we should have suction options so the mirror can be moved when needed. Its a bit odd that an adhesive is still being used. The second critique is the use of the functions. Sometimes, I have to tap a couple of times before the device can recognize that I'm trying to change the brightness.As I mentioned before, I truly do enjoy this item, I wish I had purchased the 3x zoom or 2x zoom for a closer shave, but overall, I am satisfied. Def worth the cost, especially since I couldn't find any other mirror that comes close to being fogless.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Mirror was as exactly as described, works perfectly. I always shave in the shower, first time in years I’ve been really able to see when shaving thanks to anti fog, magnification and light. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars it works well
reviews.reviewText: The mirror works great,but I'm going to put a fender washer over the plastic mounting pc and drill it out for 3 screws that will go into a stud behind the mounting bracket.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Mirror! 3x magnification is a bit much.
reviews.reviewText: I've been a shower-shaver for years and my last anti-fog mirror in the shower finally had so much hard water scaling that it was worse than fog on a mirror! I tried a couple others that did absolutely nothing to prevent fog, so I decided to go for the bigtime with this lighted, heated mirror. It's changed my shower shaving life!Firstly, I have a small stand-in shower stall, so space is of a premium. This does extend a bit from the wall, which is necessary for being able to pivot and angle. But let's face it, in the shower on the wall, it's not needed to have 20 degrees of motion let alone the claimed 360 degrees. (That's also a misnomer, as it'll rotate 360 degrees, but that's pointless. You're still limited by the angle to the wall, but again... who cares?)As I increase in years, I actually found that the light is a great enhancement to a shower mirror that I hadn't originally looked for. Now I don't think I'll be without a lighted mirror for shaving again! Having different color temperatures and brightness levels is a perk, but again not one I would have sought out.The real game changer here is the heated function. It does take a minute or two to heat up but it's truly... THE. BEST. WAY. TO. PREVENT. FOGGING. Different coatings, materials, sprays, etc... they can help a bit but we really need to prevent the condensation in the first place, and this does the job. Even after the mirror starts to fog up, hitting the heat will clear it in a minute or two. Good stuff.So yeah... this is a GREAT mirror. Why deduct a star? Well, besides being a very critical reviewer sometimes, there are some areas to improve. The heat, for one, is only in the center of the mirror. There's a good half-inch border and the entire bottom of the mirror where the buttons are that don't heat up and therefore still get foggy. Also, the distance it extends out from the wall is a bit much. Finally, the magnification is a mixed bag. I definitely don't need magnification to get a close shave. That said, I did find it somewhat handy to get a good view on the detail areas. It's also made me realize that the nose hairs are not nearly as groomed as I'd previously thought! So there is that... but it's a bit overkill still. Something like 2x would have been ideal, perhaps.So yeah... I do really like this mirror. Enough to stop my hunt for a good replacement mirror. But the perfectionist in me does think this could be even better!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars weak attachment point -breaks with heavy ball/mirror.
reviews.reviewText: I was initially impressed with this mirror. I put it up in the shower- NOT in direct water flow. It was under my showerhead and attached with the adhesion/glue with no problem. The mirror itself was awesome, light is very bright, and the anti-fog part worked really well. After only 1 shower, probably 5-6 hours after attaching it to a cleaned surface, with regular shower steaminess, I heard this CLUNK followed by what sounds like a quarter dropping and spinning till its flat, only WAY LOUDER. (If you have kids, you end up being an expert at what causes which noises)) I knew what it was before I went in to check. The mirror was on the floor of the shower, thankfully UNbroken. The attachment in the pictures was also on the floor. It seems that the rounded (weak point) that holds of the back of the screw broke, which put too much tension on the square adhesion and pulled off dropping the mirror. This sucks. I loved how it fit in with my bathroom and actually WORKED. I am going to figure out my own way to attach the stem, because I really like this. But you guys need to figure out a better way to attach something this heavy besides a small PLASTIC round doodad held on by a thin glue pad. If it was a strong stable attachment, it would get 5 stars. I don't have an option to "contact seller" for some reason on this product. It only let me chat with an amazon online "person" and they only offer returns or replacement. No thanks- Ill figure it out myself. If the company reads this, PLEASE rework the attachment base of this mirror. I'm sure this will happen to someone else- Bummer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This a great product.
reviews.reviewText: I have had this mirror for over 3 months and it is the best shower mirror that I have ever had. I have not charged it since the original charge (I use the light and heater maybe once a week). It has always stayed fog free even when everything else around me is fogged up. When there are dried water spots on it a wet and dry paper towel brings it back to like new. I can't say enough good things. Try it you won't be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024

reviews.reviewText: It takes a minute to understand how it works. You have to hold down the defog button to activate it. Once you’ve figured that out it works as advertised.
